intro: Dalechampia decaryi, commonly known as the Decary's spurge, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically features upright stems and palmate leaves with a waxy texture. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
